reasoning: Q2 revenue rose 3.5% y/y and 4.4% q/q, with YTD up 5.4% ex-attrition, indicating resumed growth though at modest rates.
Adjusted EBITDA was $154M in Q2 and $296.1M YTD with margins of 63.8% and 62.6%, reflecting strong profitability and cost control.
New pipeline creation exceeded $130M with a 77% increase since January; growth areas (VDHP and DNDS) are ~40% of the pipeline, signaling robust future demand.
A top-5 and a top-20 client were renewed for five years, nine new logos were signed, and 135 opportunities closed with $16M ACV, reflecting strong commercial traction.
Three new provider logos and progress with the CompleteView platform indicate early success and growing pipeline in a newer vertical.
Agreements with Burjeel and Pergeo/ClaimsCare establish a foothold in MENA with clear use cases (claims/payment accuracy), pointing to meaningful overseas growth potential.
Echo delivered three new wins and integrations with athena and Oracle HCM are live, though Lantern is still early; momentum is positive but ramp is developing.
Migration to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure is on schedule with 13–17% performance improvements, supporting scalability and product velocity.
A new Chief AI Officer, a dozen predictive AI initiatives, governance via CHAI membership, and future automation use cases signal committed, responsible AI-led innovation.
Four facility closures, 3% fewer headcount y/y, and a business case office support a 10–15% multiyear net cost reduction goal despite targeted reinvestments.
HR1’s IRC 174 expensing drives $60–90M 2025 FCF benefit and ~$30M annually thereafter; some caution remains around Medicaid/RHT impacts.
Revenue guidance was raised to flat to +2% with EBITDA margin maintained and FCF midpoint lifted to flat; tone is constructive but conservatively framed.
Shares ranked among top 15 small-cap performers YTD, re-entry to the Russell 2000, and ~1,000 bps debt pricing improvement underscore external confidence.
Payment and Revenue Integrity posted a strong quarter with higher savings yield; ACE grew double digits, and IDR outcomes improved with a reported ~22% CMS win rate.
